title: Build Your First Website
description: Create a personal portfolio website using HTML and CSS to showcase your skills.
instructions:
Create a responsive personal portfolio website with the following requirements:

1. Use semantic HTML5 elements
2. Include a header with navigation
3. Add sections for About, Projects, and Contact
4. Style with CSS (no frameworks allowed)
5. Make it responsive for mobile devices
6. Include at least 3 placeholder projects
7. Add a contact form

Submit your HTML and CSS files along with screenshots of your website.

rubric.description: Proper use of semantic HTML5 elements and clean structure
Effective use of CSS for styling and responsive layout
Quality of content and overall design aesthetics
Website works well on different screen sizes

title: JavaScript Calculator Project
description: Build a functional calculator using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript with advanced operations.
instructions:
Create a calculator web application with the following features:

1. Basic operations: +, -, *, /
2. Advanced operations: %, √, x²
3. Clear and backspace functionality
4. Keyboard support
5. Handle edge cases (division by zero, etc.)
6. Clean, modern UI design
7. Error handling and validation

Requirements:
- Use vanilla JavaScript (no libraries)
- Implement proper error handling
- Include comprehensive comments in your code
- Test all functionality thoroughly

Submit your complete project files and a demo video.

rubric.description: Proper handling of edge cases and errors

title: Data Analysis Project
description: Perform comprehensive data analysis on a real-world dataset using Python and pandas.
instructions:
Choose one of the provided datasets and perform a complete data analysis:

Dataset Options:
1. Sales data from an e-commerce company
2. Student performance in various subjects
3. Weather patterns over 10 years
4. Stock market data for tech companies

Required Analysis:
1. Data cleaning and preprocessing
2. Exploratory data analysis (EDA)
3. Statistical summary and insights
4. Data visualizations (minimum 5 charts)
5. Correlation analysis
6. Conclusions and recommendations

Deliverables:
- Jupyter notebook with complete analysis
- PDF report summarizing findings
- Presentation slides (max 10 slides)

Use pandas, matplotlib, seaborn, and numpy libraries.

rubric.description: Effective handling of missing values, outliers, and data preparation
Thorough exploration of data patterns and relationships
Clear, informative, and well-designed charts and graphs
